item.title: EUREKA
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: This real-time interactive art piece, named “EUREKA,” aims to create a sensory experience for the audience. The visual installations in the restaurant feature light spheres in two scenes – one underwater and the other on the sea surface. As guests enjoy sparkling wine, bubbles rise in their mouths, mirroring the ascent of the light […]
item.content:encoded:
This real-time interactive art piece, named “EUREKA,” aims to create a sensory experience for the audience.
The visual installations in the restaurant feature light spheres in two scenes – one underwater and the other on the sea surface.
As guests enjoy sparkling wine, bubbles rise in their mouths, mirroring the ascent of the light sphere on the screen.
The gradual experience of sipping, combined with the passage of time, allows one to feel the subtle changes in intoxication and the swaying motion of the ocean.
It’s like being on a yacht, observing light play on the sea surface, or diving into the water to dance with the tides – a serene and dreamlike encounte

item.title: Unreal Pikachu
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: ﻿   This artwork represents a deliberate exploration of audio reactivity, where I consciously blur the distinctions between realism and surrealism.
item.content:encoded: This artwork represents a deliberate exploration of audio reactivity, where I consciously blur the distinctions between realism and surrealism.

item.title: Echooo – Outdoor Interactive Installation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: ﻿   Official Site   “ECHOOO” invites you to a transformative outdoor interactive installation at the New Taipei City Art Museum. Featured in the 2023 Taiwan Design Expo, this experience melds the cultural and natural essence of New Taipei City through dynamic light projections. The large light sensor empowers you to shape the real-time visual […]
item.content:encoded:
Official Site

 

“ECHOOO” invites you to a transformative outdoor interactive installation at the New Taipei City Art Museum.
Featured in the 2023 Taiwan Design Expo, this experience melds the cultural and natural essence of New Taipei City through dynamic light projections.
The large light sensor empowers you to shape the real-time visual and auditory spectacle on the museum’s exterior.
As “ECHOOO” breaks boundaries, it symbolizes a city of cultural integration, transcending geographical and administrative distinctions. Join us for an exceptional journey, where each touch on the sensor adds to the ever-evolving tapestry of this unique interactive performance.
Experience a convergence of art and technology in this extraordinary outdoor display.

item.title: Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival | Interactive Poster
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: ﻿   The latest poster of the Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival showcases Taiwanese abstract art by artist Paul Chiang. The paintings, inspired by Chiang’s experiences in Taitung, use light and shadows to capture emotions and reflect the impact of cinema.   To engage the audience, an interactive website was created. Users can contribute their […]
item.content:encoded:
The latest poster of the Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival showcases Taiwanese abstract art by artist Paul Chiang.
The paintings, inspired by Chiang’s experiences in Taitung, use light and shadows to capture emotions and reflect the impact of cinema.

 

To engage the audience, an interactive website was created.
Users can contribute their own brushstrokes and light spots by clicking and touching the screen, creating a unique and dynamic motion poster.
The visuals are generated in real-time through code, providing instant and non-repetitive responses.
This immersive approach invites viewers to explore the visual experience of this year’s festival.

 

Interactive Website
Official Site

item.title: 2023 Taiwan Lantern Festival｜BUNNY RUNNING
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: ﻿   “BUNNY RUNNING” is an outdoor performance installation that offers a unique and immersive viewing experience. It combines a narrative-driven storyline with naked-eye 3D visual effects, somatosensory interaction, and transmedia elements. The installation uses AR camera filters to blend virtual and physical elements.   Taiwan’s Lantern Festival, traditionally marked by lantern releases, has evolved […]
item.content:encoded:
“BUNNY RUNNING” is an outdoor performance installation that offers a unique and immersive viewing experience.
It combines a narrative-driven storyline with naked-eye 3D visual effects, somatosensory interaction, and transmedia elements.
The installation uses AR camera filters to blend virtual and physical elements.

 

Taiwan’s Lantern Festival, traditionally marked by lantern releases, has evolved into a showcase for technology and artistry.
“BUNNY RUNNING” aims to bring this festival’s essence to a global audience, incorporating cel motion design for 3D character animation while carefully managing viewer comfort.
The performance concludes with a surprise transition of the virtual protagonist into a physical presence, leaving audiences with a sense of anticipation and wonder.

 

Official Site

item.title: Taipei Fine Arts Museum 40th Key Visual
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Catching and Collecting in the Sacred Forest
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The Catching and Collecting in the Sacred Forest is a new learning space based on the concept of Catch, Study, Release, in which people explore the world with their bodies, discovering, catching, and broadening their interests based on what they catch. Explore with your smartphone, capture various animals, study them, and create your very […]
item.content:encoded:
The Catching and Collecting in the Sacred Forest is a new learning space based on the concept of Catch, Study, Release, in which people explore the world with their bodies, discovering, catching, and broadening their interests based on what they catch.

Explore with your smartphone, capture various animals, study them, and create your very own collection book.

 

Endangered animals and animals that have already gone extinct live in this sacred forest.

When you touch an animal, it will turn to face you or run away.

 

When you use the smartphone’s camera to look at an animal moving in the space, and then shoot a Study Arrow at the animal in the camera’s view, the arrow flies out from the phone into the real space.

When the animal is hit by the arrow, it disappears from the space and is added to the smartphone collection.

Information about the animals you capture will be stored in the app’s collection book.

When you swipe a captured animal towards a location you can see in the app’s camera, the animal is released and returns to that location.

 

You can also throw a Study Net at your feet to catch animals.

Work together with those around you, use your body to drive animals into the Study Net to capture them, and watch as they disappear from the space and, at the same time, appear in your collection book.

Swipe the captured animals away to release them at your feet.

 

The more you capture the same animal, the more detailed information you can record in your collection book.

 

Official Site

item.title: LUXE
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: LUXE is a real-time interactive projection mapping ice skating show held in the Yokohama arena in May of 2021. We cooperated with people from different teams and companies such as skaters, dancers, directors, lighting, sounds, sensors, and projections. The interaction we created based on real-time tracking of skaters’ positions.   Luxe Official Site Project […]
item.content:encoded:
LUXE is a real-time interactive projection mapping ice skating show held in the Yokohama arena in May of 2021.

We cooperated with people from different teams and companies such as skaters, dancers, directors, lighting, sounds, sensors, and projections.

The interaction we created based on real-time tracking of skaters’ positions.

 

Luxe Official Site
Project on teamLab

item.title: Proliferating Immense Life – A Whole Year per Year
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Throughout the year, with the passing of time, flowers bloom and change. They bud, grow, and blossom before their petals begin to wither and eventually fade away. The cycle of growth and decay repeats itself in perpetuity. When people touch them, the flowers scatter, wither, and die.   The artwork is not a pre-recorded […]
item.content:encoded:
Throughout the year, with the passing of time, flowers bloom and change.

They bud, grow, and blossom before their petals begin to wither and eventually fade away.

The cycle of growth and decay repeats itself in perpetuity.

When people touch them, the flowers scatter, wither, and die.

 

The artwork is not a pre-recorded image that is played back: it is created by a computer program that continuously renders the work in real time.

The interaction between people and the installation causes continuous change in the artwork: previous visual states can never be replicated, and will never reoccur.

The picture at this moment can never be seen again.

 

Official Site
